sentences.sentence: Several people are reported to have been killed in airstrikes in both Ukraine and Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: On Thursday, missiles hit targets in multiple regions across Ukraine, damaging homes and infrastructure facilities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Crews and ballistic missiles were fired at locations as far west as Lviv, close to the border with Poland.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A number of people were injured in the strikes. Ukrainian officials say some of at least 10 projectiles were intercepted.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Kupyansk in the east was also hit and at least two people were said to have died in the overnight assault. Russia has in recent weeks intensified air attacks while Ukraine has also stepped up cross-border strikes into Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The governor of Belgorod region says six people were killed and 18 injured in the border city in Russia when a barrage of Ukrainian missiles struck a shopping mall. EU Commissioner and former Lithuanian Minister Virginius Sinkevicius says the horrors of

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: living under Soviet rule is still a living memory for Lithuanians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Euronews joined him in Ukraine recently, where he met with President Zelensky.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Lithuania, the first of the three Baltics to declare independence from the Soviet Union in 1990, is one of the strongest per capita donors of military and financial aid to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's first of all about our history, when hundreds and thousands, if you were a family of teachers, if you were a large farmer, most likely you were sent to Siberia, where most of the people never came back, they never returned.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: So, you know, and if you look, not so much changed. So many kidnapped children, so many families which had to go through some camps in Russia and etc. So, I mean, this ethnic cleanest ink what what they doing has not changed this imperial ambition which which which they imposing now on Ukraine and Lithuania still remembers of course the the part of its tragic history part of the wake-up call for Europe after Russia's full-ground invasion of Ukraine he says is how to avoid further complacency when it comes to security matters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: For the Western world, it's extremely important to make sure that we have a plan to support Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Because now this decision-making, when it's so long, when we have to fight for every decision, that sends a very positive signal to Moscow, first of all, and very negative to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I think the mistake is that there is still thinking that, you know, one month or the other month it can be over.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We see that Russia is gambling exactly on that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: They are waiting off. They are waiting for elections in the US, elections in the EU, and it might be a completely different view.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We already see some of the new governments in the EU who are not so supportive of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And what do you say to Viktor Orban?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I think it's shameful not to see obvious, for example, decisions to postpone, decisions not to have a vote on Sweden joining NATO.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: That's obvious actions against the collective security, against the interests of the EU, against the interests of the Western world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And that's something that can only satisfy one side, the Moscow regime.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Therefore, it's not a good timing to take for granted.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's time to actually increase our defense capabilities, defense industry, in order to not only provide for Ukraine, but also to provide for ourselves.

sentences.sentence: Temple of the offensive operations in Ukraine through 2025 says the Institute for the study of war the UK Defense Ministry recently said that the average daily number of Russian casualties in Ukraine has risen by almost 300 during the course of 2023. if the numbers continue the current rate over the next year russia will have lost over half a million personnel in ukraine in early december it reported that the assaults on avdivka have resulted in 90 increase in russian casualties ukraine said on thursday it was withdrawing troops from some parts of the eastern town of avdivka to better position after a month of heavy fighting ukraine's third assault brigade considered to be one of ukraine's largest and best equipped confirmed that it was urgently redeployed to avdivka adding that the situation in the area is quote hell and extremely critical the institute for the study of war says that there are no confirmed changes to the front line in this area although russian forces reportedly advanced in the south and north of divka russian sources claim that russian forces advanced to or even beyond the main ukrainian ground line of communication in avdivka along industrial avenue which then becomes grushevsky street ukrainian military sources say that the supply and evacuation of Avdiivka has become challenging, but alternative logistics routes prepared in advance have been activated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: More than 75% of the total number of journalists and media workers killed globally have died

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: in the war in Gaza. More journalists were killed in the first three months of this war than have ever been killed in a single country over an entire year. These are the chilling figures of the new report published Thursday by the Committee to Protect Journalists. CPJ is investigating whether a dozen journalists killed in the Israel-Gaza war were deliberately targeted by Israeli soldiers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: 72 Palestinian journalists were killed in Israeli attacks on Gaza.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In contrast, 22 journalists and media workers were killed in 18 countries outside the conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The 2023 numbers are the highest since 2015 and show almost a 44% increase on 2022's figures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: CPJ's 2023 data shows that targeting of journalists remains constant in Mexico, Somalia and the Philippines, countries that have proven deadly for journalists over decades.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Two journalists were killed in Mexico in 2023, a decrease from its record of 13 in 2022.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Yet media workers continue to face attacks, harassment, threats and abduction amid corruption and organized crime in one of the world's deadliest countries for the press.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Αλλά το κυβέρνημα αρκεί ότι η πρόσφαση θα αυτοκίνησε μια αδικία που έχει εμπλέει πολλές χρόνια.

Ο Παπαδόπολος Λίνα Παπαδόπολος, Παπαδόπολος του Κωνσταντινού, έχει δραφτεί και τους παίρνει τη μία μαμά, τους τη στερεί, την αφαιρεί από τα έγγραφά τους και τους λέει δεν έχετε δεύτερη μαμά.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Τα παιδιά αυτά γνωρίζουν ότι έχουν δεύτερη μαμά. Το ξέρουν. Το ζούνε. Το ζούνε κάθε μέρα.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Άρα λοιπόν το πρώτο και πολύ σημαντικό είναι ότι αυτά τα παιδιά πια δεν θα στερούνται εξαιτίας της πολιτείας και εξαιτίας μιας κρατικής απόφασης τον δεύτερο γονιό τους.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Με την υπερψήφιση του νομοσχεδίου, η Ελλάδα γίνεται η 16η χώρα μέλος της Ευρωπαϊκής Ένωσης που επιτρέπει στα ομόφυλα ζευγάρια να παντρευτούν με πολιτικό γάμο.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Για τη ΛΟΑΤΚΙ πλάσκη κοινότητα αυτή είναι μια σημαντική νίκη και μια στιγμή που περίμενε εδώ και πολλά χρόνια.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Όμως το σημαντικότερο είναι πως επιτέλους κατοχυρώνονται τα δικαιώματα των παιδιών των ομόφυλων ζευγαριών που μέχρι σήμερα για το κράτος ήταν περίπου αόρατα.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Japan's economy is now the world's fourth largest after it contracted in the last quarter of 2023

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: and fell behind Germany. The government reported the economy shrank at an annual rate of 0.4% in October to December, according to Cabinet Office data on RealGDPp though it grew 1.9 percent for all of 2023 it contracted 2.9 in july to september two straight quarters of contraction are considered an indicator an economy is in a technical recession japan's economy was the second largest until 2010 when it was overtaken by china's japan's nominal GDP totaled $4.2 trillion last year, while Germany's was $4.4 trillion. A weaker Japanese yen was a key factor in the drop to fourth place, since comparisons of nominal GDP are in dollar terms.
